name: Email.Html
comment:
Only html tags that are supported by major all email clients are listed here.
If you need something not that's included (and potentially not universally supported) use [`node`](#node).

These sources were used to determine what should be included:
<https://www.campaignmonitor.com/css/color-background/background/>
<https://www.pinpointe.com/blog/email-campaign-html-and-css-support>
<https://www.caniemail.com/>

Open an issue on github if something is missing or incorrectly included.


# Html tags

@docs a, b, br, div, font, h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, hr, img, label, li, node, ol, p, span, strong, table, td, text, th, tr, u, ul, Html, Attribute


# Inline images

@docs inlineGifImg, inlineJpgImg, inlinePngImg


# Convert

@docs toHtml, toString

values.name: inlineGifImg
values.comment:
If you want to embed a gif within the email body, use this function.
The normal approach of using a base64 string as the image src doesn't always with emails.

Note that [some email clients](https://www.caniemail.com/search/?s=gif) won't animate the gif.
values.type: Bytes.Bytes -> List.List Email.Html.Attribute -> List.List Email.Html.Html -> Email.Html.Html

values.name: inlineJpgImg
values.comment:
If you want to embed a jpg image within the email body, use this function.
The normal approach of using a base64 string as the image src doesn't always with emails.
values.type: Bytes.Bytes -> List.List Email.Html.Attribute -> List.List Email.Html.Html -> Email.Html.Html

values.name: inlinePngImg
values.comment:
If you want to embed a png image within the email body, use this function.
The normal approach of using a base64 string as the image src doesn't always work with emails.
values.type: Bytes.Bytes -> List.List Email.Html.Attribute -> List.List Email.Html.Html -> Email.Html.Html

values.name: node
values.comment: This allows you to create html tags not included in this module (at the risk of it not rendering correctly in some email clients).
values.type: String.String -> List.List Email.Html.Attribute -> List.List Email.Html.Html -> Email.Html.Html

values.name: toHtml
values.comment: Convert [`Email.Html.Html`](#Html) into normal a [`Html`](https://package.elm-lang.org/packages/elm/html/latest/Html). Useful if you want to preview your email content.

values.name: toString
values.comment:
Convert [`Email.Html.Html`](#Html) into normal html text. Email.Html.toString myHtml --> "
Hello!
"

name: Email.Html.Attributes
comment:
Only html attributes that are supported by all major email clients are listed here.
If you need something not that's included (and potentially not universally supported) use [`attribute`](#attribute) or [`style`](#style).

These sources were used to determine what should be included:
<https://www.campaignmonitor.com/css/color-background/background/>
<https://www.pinpointe.com/blog/email-campaign-html-and-css-support>
<https://www.caniemail.com/>

Open an issue on github if something is missing or incorrectly included.


# Attributes and styles

@docs alt, attribute, backgroundColor, border, borderBottom, borderBottomColor, borderBottomStyle, borderBottomWidth, borderColor, borderLeft, borderLeftColor, borderLeftStyle, borderLeftWidth, borderRadius, borderRight, borderRightColor, borderRightStyle, borderRightWidth, borderStyle, borderTop, borderTopColor, borderWidth, color, fontFamily, fontSize, fontStyle, fontVariant, height, href, letterSpacing, lineHeight, padding, paddingBottom, paddingLeft, paddingRight, paddingTop, src, style, textAlign, verticalAlign, width

values.name: attribute
values.comment:
Use this if there's a attribute you want to add that isn't present in this module.
Note that there's a risk that it isn't supported by some email clients.

values.name: style
values.comment:
Use this if there's a style you want to add that isn't present in this module.
Note that there's a risk that it isn't supported by some email clients.

unions.name: EmailAddress
unions.comment: The type of an email address

values.name: fromString
values.comment:
Parse an email address from a String.
Note that this will also convert all the characters to lowercase.
This is done because email addresses are case insensitive.
If the email wasn't converted to all lowercase you could end up with this gotcha `Email.fromString a@a.com /= Email.fromString A@a.com`

values.name: toString
values.comment: Render Email to a String

name: Postmark

unions.name: ApiKey
unions.comment: A SendGrid API key. In order to send an email you must have one of these (see the readme for how to get one).

unions.name: Attachments
unions.comment:
A group of email attachments.

Note that the contents of each attachment has to be base64 encoded. This can be slow for large attachments so reuse the same `Attachment` for multiple emails if possible.

unions.name: EmailBody
unions.comment:
What kind of email content are you sending? Just plain text (TextBody), HTML (HtmlBody), or both (HtmlAndTextBody).
    If you do send HTML, it's recommended to also send a plain text version for accessibility and it might reduce the odds of the email getting blocked by a spam filter.

    Note that email clients are quite limited in what html features are supported!
    To avoid accidentally using html that's unsupported by some email clients, the `Email.Html` and `Email.Html.Attributes` modules only define tags and attributes with universal support.
    You can still use `Email.Html.node` and `Email.Html.Attributes.attribute` if you want something that might not be universally supported though.

unions.name: MessageStream
unions.comment: What type of email are you sending? `TransactionalEmail` is for high priority email intended for a single recipient (a login link for example). `BroadcastEmail` is for emails to be sent to many recipients (a product announcement or a terms of service change). `OtherMessageStream` is in case you have created additional message streams.

unions.name: SendEmailError
unions.comment:
Possible errors we might get back when trying to send an email.
Some are just normal HTTP errors and others are specific to the Postmark API.

unions.name: SendEmailsError
unions.comment:
Possible errors we might get back when trying to send multiple emails.
Some are just normal HTTP errors and others are specific to the Postmark API.

aliases.name: Email
aliases.type: { from : { name : String.String, email : EmailAddress.EmailAddress }, to : List.Nonempty.Nonempty { name : String.String, email : EmailAddress.EmailAddress }, subject : String.Nonempty.NonemptyString, body : Postmark.EmailBody, messageStream : Postmark.MessageStream, attachments : Postmark.Attachments }

aliases.name: PostmarkError_
aliases.comment: Error message you can potentially get from Postmark
aliases.type: { errorCode : Basics.Int, message : String.String, to : List.List EmailAddress.EmailAddress }

values.name: apiKey
values.comment: Create an API key from a raw string (see the readme for how to get one).

values.name: attachments
values.comment:
Create attachments to be shown at the bottom of an email. If you want to have inline image attachments, use `Email.Html.inlineGifImg`, `Email.Html.inlineJpgImg`, or `Email.Html.inlinePngImg`

Note that the contents of each attachment has to be base64 encoded. This can be slow for large attachments so you might want to reuse the same `Attachment` for multiple emails if possible.
values.type: Dict.Dict String.String { content : Bytes.Bytes, mimeType : String.String } -> Postmark.Attachments

values.name: noAttachments
values.comment: Don't include any attachments in the email.

values.name: sendEmail
values.comment:
Send an email

    import EmailAddress exposing (EmailAddress)
    import List.Nonempty
    import Postmark

    {-| An email to be sent to a recipient's email address.
    -}
    email : EmailAddress -> Cmd Msg
    email recipient =
        Postmark.sendEmail
            SentEmail
            postmarkApiKey
            { from = { name = "ascii-collab", email = asciiCollabEmail }
            , to = List.Nonempty.fromElement { name = "", email = recipient }
            , subject = subject
            , body = Postmark.TextBody "Hello! Here's your login code 123123"
            , messageStream = Postmark.TransactionalEmail
            , attachments = Postmark.noAttachments
            }
values.type: (Result.Result Postmark.SendEmailError () -> msg) -> Postmark.ApiKey -> Postmark.Email -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: sendEmailTask
sendEmails
values.comment: Send multiple emails in a single API request. See more here <https://postmarkapp.com/developer/user-guide/send-email-with-api/batch-emails>
values.type: (Result.Result Postmark.SendEmailsError () -> msg) -> Postmark.ApiKey -> List.Nonempty.Nonempty Postmark.Email -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: sendEmailsTask
values.comment: Task version of `sendEmails`

name: SendGrid
comment: @docs ApiKey, apiKey, textEmail, htmlEmail, addCc, addBcc, addAttachments, sendEmail, sendEmailTask, Email, Error, ErrorMessage, ErrorMessage403

unions.name: ApiKey
unions.comment: A SendGrid API key. In order to send an email you must have one of these (see the readme for how to get one).

unions.name: Error
unions.comment:
Possible error codes we might get back when trying to send an email.
Some are just normal HTTP errors and others are specific to the SendGrid API.
cases: { errors : List.List SendGrid.ErrorMessage403, id : Maybe.Maybe String.String }

aliases.name: ErrorMessage
aliases.comment: The content of a generic SendGrid error.
aliases.type: { field : Maybe.Maybe String.String, message : String.String, errorId : Maybe.Maybe String.String }

aliases.name: ErrorMessage403
aliases.comment: The content of a 403 status code error.
aliases.type: { message : Maybe.Maybe String.String, field : Maybe.Maybe String.String, help : Maybe.Maybe String.String }

values.name: addAttachments
values.type: Dict.Dict String.String { content : Bytes.Bytes, mimeType : String.String } -> SendGrid.Email -> SendGrid.Email

values.name: addBcc
values.comment: Add a list of [BCC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blind_carbon_copy) recipients.

values.name: addCc
values.comment: Add a list of [CC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carbon_copy) recipients.

values.name: apiKey
values.comment: Create an API key from a raw string (see the readme for how to get one).

values.name: htmlEmail
values.comment:
Create an email that contains html.

    import EmailAddress
    import List.Nonempty
    import Sendgrid
    import String.Nonempty exposing (NonemptyString)

    {-| An email to be sent to a recipient's email address.
    -}
    email : (Result SendGrid.Error () -> msg) -> EmailAddress -> SendGrid.ApiKey -> Cmd msg
    email msg recipient apiKey =
        SendGrid.textEmail
            { subject = NonemptyString 'S' "ubject"
            , to = List.Nonempty.fromElement recipient
            , content = NonemptyString 'H' "i!"
            , nameOfSender = "Sender Name"
            , emailAddressOfSender = senderEmailAddress
            }
            |> SendGrid.sendEmail msg apiKey

Note that email clients are quite limited in what html features are supported!
To avoid accidentally using html that's unsupported by some email clients, the `Email.Html` and `Email.Html.Attributes` modules only define tags and attributes with universal support.
You can still use `Email.Html.node` and `Email.Html.Attributes.attribute` if you want something that might not be universally supported though.
values.type: { subject : String.Nonempty.NonemptyString, content : Email.Html.Html, to : List.Nonempty.Nonempty EmailAddress.EmailAddress, nameOfSender : String.String, emailAddressOfSender : EmailAddress.EmailAddress } -> SendGrid.Email

values.name: sendEmail
values.comment: Send an email using the SendGrid API.
values.type: (Result.Result SendGrid.Error () -> msg) -> SendGrid.ApiKey -> SendGrid.Email -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg

values.name: sendEmailTask
values.comment: Send an email using the SendGrid API. This is the task version of [sendEmail](#sendEmail).

values.name: textEmail
values.comment:
Create an email that only contains plain text.

    import EmailAddress
    import List.Nonempty
    import Sendgrid
    import String.Nonempty exposing (NonemptyString)

    {-| An email to be sent to a recipient's email address.
    -}
    email : EmailAddress -> SendGrid.Email
    email recipient =
        SendGrid.textEmail
            { subject = NonemptyString 'S' "ubject"
            , to = List.Nonempty.fromElement recipient
            , content = NonemptyString 'H' "i!"
            , nameOfSender = "test name"
            , emailAddressOfSender = senderEmailAddress
            }
values.type: { subject : String.Nonempty.NonemptyString, content : String.Nonempty.NonemptyString, to : List.Nonempty.Nonempty EmailAddress.EmailAddress, nameOfSender : String.String, emailAddressOfSender : EmailAddress.EmailAddress } -> SendGrid.Email
